title: EU consumers back call for more stringent eco-labels on confectionery and other food products - ConfectioneryNews.com
summary: The European Commission is considering proposals to address misleading environmental claims, including a 'Product Environmental Footprint' methodology and a ban on new public labeling schemes unless they are EU-developed. Research shows strong consumer interest in a universal eco-label, with many believing food brands exaggerate sustainability claims. Trust in government regulation of sustainability labels varies significantly among European countries. The aim of the Consumer Observatory is to enhance consumer insights in the food system towards promoting healthier and more sustainable food options.
green_innovation: TRUE - The article discusses the development of a universal eco-label and regulations to combat misleading sustainability claims, contributing to environmental sustainability goals.
business_innovation: TRUE - The proposal for a standardized eco-label represents a new approach in how businesses can market their products by aligning with sustainability standards.
green_product: FALSE - No specific green product is named or described in the article.
green_process: FALSE - The article does not describe a specific green process.
likely_naics_codes: Likely NAICS Codes: 541620 - Environmental Consulting Services, 541910 - Marketing Research and Public Opinion Polling, 331318 - Other Aluminum Rolling, Drawing, and Extruding, 339999 - All Other Miscellaneous Manufacturing
greenwashing: FALSE - The article does not appear to describe greenwashing, but rather addresses the need for clear and truthful environmental labeling to combat misleading claims.

title: Nestlé invests £7 million into new hard-to-recycle plastics plant - FoodNavigator.com
summary: Nestlé is investing £7 million in Impact Recycling to develop a new recycling facility in the UK aimed at handling hard-to-recycle plastics used in food packaging. This facility will implement innovative recycling technology, producing high-purity resin for reuse in new products. The initiative aligns with government strategies to improve plastic recycling rates and minimize environmental impacts. Nestlé aims to ensure all its packaging is recyclable or reusable by 2025.
green_innovation: TRUE, because the investment in recycling technology and the establishment of a facility focused on improving the recycling of hard-to-recycle plastics promotes environmental sustainability by minimizing waste and enhancing recycling capacity.
business_innovation: TRUE, because the collaboration and investment in a new recycling facility by Nestlé and Impact Recycling represents a significant improvement in their operational processes that addresses the recycling challenges faced by the food and beverage industry.
green_product: FALSE, as the article does not specify a particular good or service that meets the green product criteria; it discusses plans for a recycling process instead.
green_process: TRUE, because the recycling facility and its technology are aimed at reducing environmental impact by recycling difficult materials, thereby promoting sustainable practices in plastic waste management.
likely_naics_codes: Likely NAICS Codes: 325211 - Plastics Material and Resin Manufacturing, 562920 - Materials Recovery Facilities, 311930 - Snack and Nonalcoholic Beverage Bars, 541715 - Research and Development in the Physical, Engineering, and Life Sciences (except Nanotechnology and Biotechnology)
greenwashing: FALSE, because there are substantial actions and investments being made towards genuine recycling innovation and infrastructure improvement, which do not represent misleading or exaggerated claims.

title: PepsiCo pushes entrepreneurial collaboration as 'vital' APAC sustainability strategy - FoodNavigator-Asia.com
summary: PepsiCo launched the Greenhouse Accelerator Programme in the APAC region to support sustainability-focused start-ups. Powered Carbon won the programme for its eco-friendly fertiliser derived from carbon dioxide, which aims to significantly reduce greenhouse gas emissions. The programme is part of PepsiCo’s pep+ transformation strategy aimed at net zero and responsible growth. The innovation is being tested on potatoes in PepsiCo’s supply chain.
green_innovation: TRUE - The initiatives and products discussed contribute to environmental sustainability by focusing on sustainable packaging and reducing greenhouse gas emissions through innovative technologies.
business_innovation: TRUE - Powered Carbon's new technology for eco-friendly fertiliser is an improved business process that differs significantly from traditional fertilisers, thus qualifying as business innovation.
green_product: TRUE - The fertiliser produced by Powered Carbon utilizes CO2 and is designed to minimize environmental impact, making it a green product.
green_process: TRUE - The process of using carbon capture and storage technology to produce fertiliser represents a method that minimizes environmental impacts and promotes sustainability.

greenwashing: FALSE - There is no evidence of misleading statements; the article details genuine sustainability efforts and the support for green innovations aimed at reducing environmental impacts.

title: Global Denim Jeans Strategic Market Report 2023-2030 - Denim Enters Dynamic Times with Innovations to Push ... - GlobeNewswire
summary: The global denim jeans market is projected to grow from $70.1 million in 2022 to $114.6 million by 2030, with a compound annual growth rate (CAGR) of 6.3%. The analysis covers various sales channels, geographical markets, and highlights trends such as a focus on sustainability and innovations in denim production. Notably, the online segment is expected to grow at a higher rate of 12.5% CAGR, indicating a shift in consumer purchasing behavior. The forecast includes key markets such as the US and China, with strategic insights on competition and market dynamics.
green_innovation: FALSE - The article does not clearly describe innovations that specifically contribute to environmental sustainability goals or reduce negative externalities. While it mentions a focus on sustainability in the denim industry, it does not provide specific examples of green innovations.
business_innovation: TRUE - The article discusses the denim jeans market as a dynamic sector with innovations and new business models, qualifying it as a business innovation due to the introduction of new strategies and improved products in the market.
green_product: FALSE - The article does not explicitly define any denim jeans as green products, despite mentioning sustainability trends. It lacks details on specific environmentally friendly aspects of the products.
green_process: FALSE - There are no specific green processes detailed in the article; it addresses trends but does not identify specific methods that minimize environmental impacts.

greenwashing: FALSE - The article does not engage in greenwashing as it does not make false or misleading claims about the environmental benefits of denim products. It presents market trends without exaggerating the sustainability aspects.

title: Mars rethinks recipes, ingredients on journey to Net Zero - FoodNavigator.com
summary: Mars Inc. aims to reach net zero emissions across its full value chain by 2050, with a roadmap to halve emissions by 2030. The company is focusing on ingredient innovation, including the development of allulose as a natural sugar substitute and partnerships with third-party suppliers for sustainable ingredients. Mars is also improving the sustainability of its existing ingredients and incorporating sustainability considerations into its mergers and acquisitions strategy. Notably, Mars' collaboration with Perfect Day for animal-free proteins and its commitment to reduce its dairy supply footprint exemplify its focus on sustainability.
green_innovation: TRUE, because the article discusses Mars' efforts in reducing greenhouse gas emissions, optimizing ingredient sourcing, and developing sustainable ingredients and processes, all of which contribute to environmental sustainability.
business_innovation: TRUE, as Mars is introducing new and improved products, such as allulose and sustainable proteins, which differ significantly from its previous offerings.
green_product: TRUE, since allulose, a natural sugar substitute developed through a process that reduces environmental impacts and contributes to lower calorie intake, meets the criteria of a green product.
green_process: TRUE, because the development of allulose through precise fermentation represents a new method in production that minimizes environmental impact, aligns with sustainable practices, and uses renewable resources.
likely_naics_codes: Likely NAICS Codes: 311320 - Snack Food Manufacturing; 311330 - Sugar Manufacturing; 311990 - All Other Food Manufacturing; 325199 - All Other Basic Organic Chemical Manufacturing
greenwashing: FALSE, as the article presents credible efforts and specific actions taken by Mars Inc. to achieve sustainability goals without unsubstantiated claims.

title: Top 10 Best Paper Manufacturing Companies In India 2024 - Inventiva
summary: India's paper manufacturing industry is evolving with a focus on innovation and sustainability, driven by environmental concerns and government regulations. The top paper manufacturers are adopting eco-friendly practices, minimizing waste, and reducing energy consumption while also leveraging digital technology for operational improvements. This dynamic landscape highlights the balance between economic growth and environmental stewardship. Overall, these companies are committed to quality, sustainability, and customer satisfaction.
green_innovation: TRUE: The article discusses several paper manufacturing companies adopting eco-friendly practices and technologies that contribute to sustainability and minimize environmental impact.
business_innovation: TRUE: The companies mentioned in the article are implementing new or improved manufacturing processes and products that differentiate them from previous operations, positioning them as innovative in the paper industry.
green_product: TRUE: The paper products produced by these companies are designed and manufactured to reduce environmental impact and promote sustainability throughout their life cycle.
green_process: TRUE: The article describes the use of advanced manufacturing processes that minimize environmental impacts, conserve resources, and reduce waste, qualifying as green processes.
